title: Announcements / About this forum
post_content: Dear all,since the Nord USA forum (http://www.nordusa.com/index.php) ceased to exist in January 2009, the YAHOO group on the Nord Stage:http://launch.groups.yahoo.com/group/nordstage/messagesseems to be the only forum at the moment dedicated to this nice piece of gear from Clavia. Besides, there is a small forum I just recently found on:http://electro-music.com/forum/forum-166.htmlThis is why I decided to create a possibility more easily accessible for people potentially turned away by the fact that one has to have a Yahoo account to access this highly informative database.Moreover, I wanted to create the possibility to easily exchange and discuss (in particular with the possibility to discuss and include MP3 previews) user patches created for the Nord Stage. From my own experience, in particular the Synthesizer section -while obviously being less versatile than e.g. the Nord Lead, still provides enough tweaking possibilities to create basically anything one might want to use as sounds. Given that it takes time and effort to put a decent sound together, I thought this might encourage people to contribute their sounds and test other peoples'. The possibility of directly uploading your patch files and MP3 samples that are converted to be played back directly in the browser hould, I hope, encourage us to get the best sounds out of the Nord Stage.Given the highly increased traffic due to this forum I had to upgrade my webhosting account and plan to move this forum to its own domain if it really becomes a valuable resource.If you have and suggestion or comment, please post it here!Best,Johannes Emmerling

title: RE: Announcements / About this forum
post_content: Yeah, It is really a pity that all the useful information on the NordUSA forum is being lost...And regarding the Yahoo group, I also really enjoy the lively discussion there. And I did not want to create a competition/otherwise redundant "NEW" forum.My main motivation was to fully make use of the Synth of the Stage by providing an easy to use Soundpatch database with the possibility to discuss directly and in particular to provide an easy mp3preview functionality.So today I added severalRSS feedsfor the whole forum or its sub-fora so just click in your browsers URL field and you can easily check the most recent posts without having to navigate through the forum.cheers, Johannes

title: RE: Announcements / About this forum
post_content: Just for those curious why this forum was not available during the last days: My provider is phasing economic and technical difficulties and had a server crash while at the same time I moved to a new, more powerful and reliable server including more features such as larger file allowances etc. which will be better for future growth.After four(!) days of fiddling with PHP javascript, different upgrade incompatibilities etc. the database is back as it was and I can sleep again. puh, or, I mean, practice the piano ;-)Sorry for the inconveniences!JEDIT: For the moment, the only thing that seems to have been lost are the avatar pictures.

title: RE: Announcements / About this forum
post_content: Dear all:Almost two years after creating this forum, I just wanted to thank all of you for actively participating in this forum around the Nord Keyboards. With now 500+ members including 350 active last month and 10.000+ visitors per months, it has become (I think) a nice resource for Nord-ists (and those who consider becoming one) any personally I learnt a lot for my music making!Last week, I started the newdownload section(accessibla from the top menu in the forum or on the right on the home page. There I plan to collect useful uploads or comprehensive discussions/posts in order to save them from getting buried in the forum.I also want to introduce and thanktoro.larssonandCbaswho have gratefully accepted to moderate this website on top of already being very helpful and kind in helping others out and sharing there experiences and knowledge!Regarding the future, I am working on minor improvements and in particular an easier way to provide (somewhat crude but still better than nothing) translations as I have been asked by many non English speaking users.Moreover, I am hoping to encourage exchanges of ideas to share the results of the sometimes hard work of creating sample sets. With the Nord Stage 2 on its way, there are now three instruments that can use user-created samples.Also, I plan to move this website to its own domain; I will see what name is feasible also with Nord's name rights. (For the time being, I changed the name to Nord Unofficial User Forum given the interest in the Electros, the NP etc., will see what seems most appropriate in the end).Feel free to express your requests, suggestions, critique or general comment as replies to this thread or PM me!Have a nice day!Johannes

title: RE: Announcements / About this forum
post_content: Recent changes:Mobile Access to the forum:(1) Using the App Tapatalkhttp://www.tapatalk.com, available for iOs, Android, Blackberry, Win7 etc. (unfortunately not free, ~2 €)(2) for the iPhone, alternatively: You can use TouchBB and find the forum here:touchbb.phpDownloads Section expanded - now various versions of documents etc. can be stored by all users, e.g., to collaborate on documents, add changes etc.Now compatible with NS2 patches, samples and programs.ATOM and RSS feeds updates: You can find them here:feed.php(ATOM) andsyndication.php(RSS)ToDo:*Domain for the Forum:nord-user-forum.comkinda obvious, it is the best I came up with so far, not loving the two dashes though.nord-stage-forum.comsame problem and more restrictivenord-forum.comis too general (like there is a forum about Nord Pas de Calais in France (remember Bienvenue chez les Ch'tis ;-) ) for instance) plus to close to NORD maybe.*fancybox to feature music of people while surfing here (like on the greate websitehttp://www.mauritsboegman.nl/)*rating feature for topicsFeel free to send me a PM if you have a great idea so I can run a poll with some proposals or reply to this thread.Cheers, Johannes

title: RE: Announcements / About this forum
post_content: Dear all:I can only repeat myself in saying that I am very happy about the way this forum is taking, heading to a thousand members, and, even more importantly, in the quality of peoples' posts and comments. Also I would like to thank all of you who wrote me over the last months suggesting new features, improvements, commenting or just giving some feedback on this little community. As I tried to address most of the issues mentioned, I wanted to briefly present the changes/improvements I implemented so far:In particular I am very happy that spam registrations have almost completely disappeared since the spam question is a more "musical" registration task ;-) So far, no(!) spammer managed to pass this very simple test ;-) here is a screenshot if you registered before:spam_question.png (5.76 KiB) Viewed 18951 timesSo for the moment I don't have to go a step further asking for a Bill Evans Voicing for G7b9 or something more complicates...Still,l with the number of members increasing, in particular, people from the US, I am particularly happy thatHanon_CTSfrom sunny Florida accepted to become the third Moderator withtoro.larssonandCbasto represent this geographical extension of the user base! Kudos to all three who have been generously very active with around 200 posts in sharing their knowledge, providing assistance and making this community work!!other changes:In the Nord Stage Section, I introduced a "Topic attribute:" as [NS C/EX], [NS2] or [General] which should be set with each new thread in order to indicate whether it is a NS2 specific question, Classic/EX, or General NS thread. This way, I hope to avoid confusion given the substantial differences of the NS2. (I did not want to open a new forum since still many issues are the same). So please use these attributes to make it easier to help you out!The separation of NS Classic/EX and NS2 patches seemed to work well, given the incompatibility this hopefully improves accessibility of the patches.Also I added a google search function in the search page if you don't succeed with the standard search engine.Since I saw a couple of For Sale/Trade posts and had some requests for that, I created a new "Garage Sales" Section (http://www.norduserforum.com/buysell/) where you can post Sale/Trade/Buy Ads. So please if you have anything to buy/sell/trade, use this section only. This way, the forum should remain free from ads, for sale/trade offers or other commercial stuff. Any related posts should be moved into this new area.Single Forum Feeds:If you wish to read only one or two of the fora, you can do so either by clicking on the RSS/ATOM icon in the address bar, or, if you want to add it, e.g., in Google Reader, choose the URL with a small suffix based on the number of a forum (last digits of the forum URLs) as follows:http://www.norduserforum.com/feed.php?f=9for the Nord Electro Forum orhttp://www.norduserforum.com/feed.php?f=3for the Nord Stage Forum orhttp://www.norduserforum.com/feed.php?f=5for the Nord Stage Classic/EX patches     etc.Photo Gallery- in order to have a central place for pictures of setups, live pictures, or from DIY jobs. In order to not let them get burried in old threads:http://www.norduserforum.com/gallery/index.phpAlso, if you have not yet come across, thanks Henrik/toro.larsson for his excellentMIDI tutorial(The Nord Stage MIDI Tutorial) which I am sure will help a lot of people in getting their setup right!!If you ever feel like leaving this community, feel free to delete your account using the option in the User Control Center, if moreover you want your posts to be removed just send me an email.Finally, since I had two requests from fellow members, you can now contribute a small donation to this forum via the Donate link on the bottom right of the page (http://www.norduserforum.com/donate.php)Have a good day!Cheers, Johannes

title: RE: Announcements / About this forum
post_content: Ritchie333 wrote:Glad to see the forum is continuing to expand, and with Nord Support getting involved in a semi-official capacity. The one thing I don't like is these stars / ranks that appear next to people such as "Member", "Senior Member", "High Priest Of The Hammond", "Keith Emerson" (okay, I might have made some of those up). Are they really necessary, other than to show how many posts someone has had? That's like judging a book by how many pages it has in it.Hi Ritchie, thanks for your comments, I agree!With regards to the stars, I understand. I activated them just a couple of weeks ago given it is widely used (with the idea behind it of at least making a distinction between someone who just randomly has a question etc. or someone who somehow proved to be a supportive guy). But I get your pages allegory even though there are some differences.Actually, I thought of it more of a method to in some sense reward helping others out, or sharing patches, etc., but a pure post count is indeed a bit like book pages...Anyway, gave it another thought and removed them, in particular since I don't like hierarchies very much and maybe the stars did insinuate something like this.Basically, I always do things kind of "into the blue" 'cause you never know what people want, so I am happy about your constructive criticism, always good if the "blue" speaks back;-)December 11th, 2011:Updates:Youtube Videos can now more easily embedded also with full linksBuy & Sell Section updated to make it more user friendly and photo upload easier.Spam Cleanup finished

title: RE: Announcements / About this forum
post_content: Dear all:yesterday we had an unusual large number of spammers trying to register to the forum, including some managed to overcome the spam protection systems and seemingly sent out a number of private messages (PMs) to fellow users. We identified and banned these registrations and removed all such messages from the system. Yet, they might have already gotten out also via email notification, so I would kindly ask you to disregard and delete such messages. I am sorry for the inconveniences. In order to prevent this from happening in the future, now sending PMs will only be available to active posters (who post at least 5 times on the forum or share Nord programs/samples), and we also increased the registration spam measures.Have a great week everyone!The Nord User Forum Team

title: RE: Here I am! My chops, my crowd, my Nord. Present yourself!
post_content: My first NORD keyboard, a new Stage 2 SW73, is on a truck to my house tonight!I am a decent amateur pianist, and play in a band with some friends.  Most everyone in our "band" (there are over 70 of us), are in our 50s and 60s. We've been playing this music for 50+ years, so we've had a lot of practice!  Since we are playing quite often, I decided to upgrade my instrument.  I believe I made a good choice after reading your fine forum for a few nights.  I promise to be a good contributing member.We are a not-for-profit corporation made up of local business people who share love for rock 'n roll.  We have a monster jam session once per month, and play 15-20 charitable events each year.  We have formed several small theme groups, among them:  British Invasion, Woodstock, Jazz Guys, Texas Flooders, Santana, Beatles Fans, Classic Rockers, Alternators, etc.  Some of the sub-groups practice every week.Here's our Woodstock group (yours truly in the middle with hat).

title: RE: Here I am! My chops, my crowd, my Nord. Present yourself!
post_content: Cheers everyone from Portugal!!I'm new to this forum, and I'm here to learn and hope to be able to help others tooI used to be a bass player in a few rock bands in the 80's, but now feel "too old" to be on bands, so I dedicate my spare time to compose and play my own music on keyboards, just for fun!Although I'm old in some other forums, after many years of Rolands, Yamahas and Korgs, I decided last week to buy a Nord Electro 6D 73 which I'm loving and avidly exploring!Despite having owned a lot of different studio equipment and Synths over the years, I learned how "to do more with less", and sold the majority of my gear. This is my actual gear:Hardware Synths:- Roland Integra 7- Behringer Deepmind 6 - New- Nord Electro 6D (73) - New- Akai XR-20 Drum Machine - NewKeyboard Controllers:- Novation impulse 61 - 4x Zones MIDI controller (in repair at the moment - missing from the picture)- Roland PCR-500 - 2x Zones MIDI ControlerSoftware Synths (all running on iPad / Alesis iO-Dock):- Korg iM1- Korg iWavestation- korg iElectribe- Korg iMS-20- Korg iPolysix- Sunrizer- Animoog- Addictive Synth- AlchemyDAWs:- Studio One 4 Professional- Cubase AI 10- Reaper 5.9- ACID Pro 7.0eStudio Equipment:- Focusrite Scarlett 18i20 3rd generation USB Audio interface- Focusrite Saffire Pro 26 Firewire/Thunderbold Audio Interface (selling it)- Behringer PX3000 Ultrapatch Pro- Edirol/Roland UM-550 MIDI Patcher- Roland R-05 Digital Recorder- Yamaha MG06X Mixer (Drums)- Presonus faderport MIDI DAW Controller- Lenovo Legion Gaming Laptop, i7 9750 6 core CPU, 16GB RAM, 1TB SSD, Windows 10- 1 pair of Fluid F5 Nearfield Monitors- 1x Quik Lok 3 tier stand- 3x Roland EV5 Control/Expression Pedals- 2x Roland DP-10 Sustain Pedals- 3x F5-5L Pedals- 1x Stagg Sustain Pedal- 1x Nektar Sustain PedalMake Music and be Happy!!PauloF

title: RE: Here I am! My chops, my crowd, my Nord. Present yourself!
post_content: I am showing my Nord Electro in use at one of our local bar gigs:I also play the sax, forming a 2 person horn section with my son, but the videos which show the horns use sounds from my Roland as opposed to my Electro, and this a Nord forum. I guess you could also consider my Korg D3200 a significant part of my gear. It is a multitrack recorder which can capture 12 tracks simultaneously, which enables me to capture our 7 piece band (with 4 people singing at once). You can barely catch a glimpse of it on the back table with its red channel lights and tiny 4 inch white screen. But its main presence is felt via your ears, since I use its mixes to provide the audio for our band videos.

post_content: Elias wrote:.....I was about to make a joke about Stevie Wonder and black notes but I think I will skip that one to not seem racist.I have often thought about how many of Stevie Wonder's songs have key signatures with many sharps or flats.There are two possible reasons for this which could both be valid:Unlike sighted individuals, Stevie Wonder is not reading the sharped or flatted notes from a page - they are already in his mind.So there is no added difficulty for him when playing songs in such keys.The other reason is that he is writing songs as a keyboard player instead of a guitar player, and thus has no predisposition to choose "guitarist-friendly" key signatures.

title: RE: Here I am! My chops, my crowd, my Nord. Present yourself!
post_content: harmonizer wrote:The other reason is that he is writing songs as a keyboard player instead of a guitar player, and thus has no predisposition to choose "guitarist-friendly" key signatures.I don't believe ANY keyboard player needs to write in "guitar-friendly" keys!Most of the stuff I do is jazz combo or big band, so I think more in horn friendly keys like Bb and Eb.Just sayin'Mike

title: RE: Here I am! My chops, my crowd, my Nord. Present yourself!
post_content: Well, I want to introduce myself. I'm new to Nords but my friend who owns 4 working and 2 sort-of-not synths recommended Nord to me. Highly.For Christmas I bought the Stage 3. Even though it's been out for a few years. I was tickled to find, though I haven't seen a lot of evidence of people opening up their Stage 3's yet (something about a warranty), Nord makes sturdy workhorses. I found they're easy to repair.I do embedded software for work. I like opening up my devices and understanding them deeply. I love the way Nord makes the interface - everything is right out in front of you. It seems very well thought out to me. I want to tinker around inside just to appreciate the elegance I can already sense is in there. (I haven't, but imagine an upgraded Stage 3 with ... I'll stop!)I read the request to Nord to make a better Nord Sound Manager or Nord Sample Editor. That was good to see, both because it saved me trouble, and because it gives me something on the software side to tinker with, which keeps me from opening up the piano itself...But I don't know, I don't want to go all wild, reverse engineering the .nsmp3 format. I like Nord. I wouldn't want to go head-to-head against them.Maybe the day will come, when their next product launches using a different DSP architecture and they end support for the old Nord Sample Editor or something (they have only so many engineers plus legacy support inevitably falls to the community anyway)... Maybe then I'll feel it's time to work on a community version of the software?Are there other folks here who think like that?!!

title: RE: Here I am! My chops, my crowd, my Nord. Present yourself!
post_content: Hello everybody !New to Nord and new to keyboards.I have been playing guitar and bass for nearly 45 years now and I thought 8 months ago that it was time to learn piano and try to do both bass and chords with the same device.I begin with a Roland FP30 (nice board by the way) but some old friends of mine wanted me to play in their band (blues cover), so I needed something easier to carry and with more sound options (organ and EP). After a month of searching for a used clonewheel/stage piano/light and easy to program keyboard (Roland V-combo, Crumar mojo and the like) in my area, I finally bought a used Electro 3 73 ... and I don't regret, this thing is just perfect for organ and EP. I still need to get used to the keybed for acoustic piano.

title: RE: Here I am! My chops, my crowd, my Nord. Present yourself!
post_content: Hi, it's time to introduce me, if I've really written 60 posts already.I'm a pastor with musical ambitions. Love to hear music from Gregorian to softer sorts of jazz - nothing stressing, the job is stressful enough. Left handed, so not dedicated to virtuous playing.Didn't hear anything other than Bach in my parent's house, but got caught for jazz in a school big band (trumpet in my case). Got my first Dizzy LP as a gift from the school band leader. Took me some years to love it. Switched the attitude towards the piano about 10 years ago and decided to develop a jazzy pop style - no classics on my piano any more (classics now is Randy Newman or Billy Joel for me, preclassics is Cole Porter or so). Meaning going from hobbyist to job related low level commitment. Which means I just play that style on single occasions in my parish and around.Now started as a keyboarder in a modern Big Band - which implicated the need for some synth sounds for the first time. But am still committed more to EP sounds, want to fathom their potential. As well as Hammond sounds. And try to figure out harmonies/scales.Music is not my only hobby, but with the purchase of my Stage 3 Compact, it's a decision to go back to taking it seriously. And professionally, I'm convinced that we still have to develop more into the pop world in old world protestantism. As much as I love classical organ music on sunday morning (and we pay a lot for those instruments!) - but shouldn't be the only sound.That should be enough for the public side. If any journalist would have the need to know more, he/she can ask - I'm a regional public relations agent as well. But at the moment, in my eyes it's not worth the effort.

title: RE: Here I am! My chops, my crowd, my Nord. Present yourself!
post_content: Hi,Grüße an alle hier, bin gerade auf dieses Forum gestoßen. Seit 3 Monaten habe ich nun mein Stage 3. Vorher hatte ich ein Kawai MP 7SE. Das Teil war mir aber zu klavierlastig. Nun habe ich auf dem Stage 3 eine relativ gute B3, das musste ich vorher über den PC (VB 3 für 120 €) laufen lassen.Als erstes habe ich mich an einen Umbau rangemacht, da ich von Beruf Elektroniker bin ging das . Hat aber ne Menge Arbeit gemacht, 2 -3 Tage. Schalter Ein/Aus zusätzlich, da der originale hinter dem Notenpult ist, und wenn das Teil an der Wand steht, ist das echt lästig. Zwei 230V-Steckdosen, eine USB-Doppeldose für Lampe und Handy/Pad und eine 9V -Buchse für's Pedal. Das hätte Nord eigentlich bei so einem hochpreisigen Teil auch anbieten können.Hier ein paar Bilder.Grüße, JürgenGreetings to all here, I just came across this forum. For 3 months I have now my Stage 3. I had a Kawai MP 7SE before. But the part was too piano to me. Now I have a relatively good B3 on the Stage 3, I had to run in advance about the PC (VB 3 for 120 €). Finally, I have myself to a rebuilding ranking, since I am an electronics technician by profession. But has made a lot of work, 2 -3 days. Switch on / off In addition, as the original is behind the music desk, and when the Board is on the wall, that's really annoying. Two 230V sockets, a USB double socket for lamp and mobile phone / pad and a 9V jack for the pedal. That would also have been able to offer North with such a high priced part.Here a few pictures.Greels, Jürgen

title: RE: Here I am! My chops, my crowd, my Nord. Present yourself!
post_content: Interesting mod, thank you for sharing it. Did you take the 9V for the pedal and the 5V for the USB from the circuit or added some other transformers?

title: RE: Here I am! My chops, my crowd, my Nord. Present yourself!
post_content: And if you did take those voltages from the circuit, do you need some sort of security measures, capacitors for example?

title: RE: Here I am! My chops, my crowd, my Nord. Present yourself!
post_content: The 9 volts for the socket pedal come from an adapter 12 V to 9 V. The 12 V are tapped from the connection plug of the mains board. The two device sockets and the USB dose are tapped directly from the 230 V input and switched off via a 1 A fine fuse. With 230 W, this should be enough for most cases. The installation location for the fine fuse is to the left of the fine fuse for the device itself, which has 125 mA. See picture 3.Since only 9 V die from the device itself die over 12 V, no further protection has been installed.The connecting wires are all separable with connectors, so that there is no need to solder large if the boards are replaced. The additional on and off switch is soldered directly to the power board. You have to look for a while to find the tap points.

post_content: Hello everyone excuse me for my bad englishFirst of all my name is dimitris but in greece all dimitri are called mitsos too.. so you can call me mitsosI am some time here around this forum and making some personal research through all the comments and topics about bugs, failures problems, keybeds etc etc on all the nord users that post in this very nice community forum… first of all i want to have full knowledge because i love the instruments and the technology and 2nd because i am selling instruments, speakers, cables etc.A little about meI am 32 years old playing music from 11 but started working in a music hall in greece at my 10 years old as a toilet cleaner and jacket holder there i heard live instruments and band for my first time and i loved it. that was my first motivation on starting music.Here in greece the music halls and restaraunts are a lot and having live music for at least 3 days per week and every live event is at least 4 to 7 hours non stop playing live music and people love dancing singing etc. back then when i was 10 the music halls were 6 days per week having 7 hours non stop live music every night ..so i grow up in music events and i became very fast proffesional musician from very small age.I gone in music school which i had to learn trumpet ( im not very good though ) and singing which i am also proffesional now.All the years i work as a musician i have permanent dissertation with sound and sound equipment. Which i also love and after many years of working i invested all my money (and i still investing) in sound and light equipment for live event's ( i own a small sound and light rental company )All these years working from small kid i was near real proffesional musicians and sound technician which helped me a lot.. and later i studied sound engineering and got my degree. And i always look forward to have friends real experienced - proffesional sound enginers and musiciansThis way i improve always becoming better..I said all these about the sound just to let you know that anything you need about sound equipment and specialy the live gig events etc  e.g equipment which ones are good or the best. Which di boxes cables or how you will route what cables you will use. Speakers etc.. you can feel free and ask me . I will gladly help youNow to the nordfrom when i was a kid i loved the piano for me is the king of all music instruments because of the polyphony.. but i never had the chance and time to study or start learning some piano cause i first loved my basic starting instrument bouzouki..So when i first heard a nord piano i loved it and i had to buy one for my sound and lights company.. this purchase was the best motivation to start playing also.. i bought ofc the most asked instrument for rental the nord stage 3 88 ha..I play now 8 months and i am able to play and sing alone for almost 2 hours non stop in my live events. Ofc my playing skills are just decent and not real pro .. with my little experience on piano i can understand and feel that this fatar keybed of stage 3 88 ha is kind of cheap.. and not very good for piano action feel and ofc isnt worth that much money.. after paying that much i expected a better keybed and not a keybed that used in 1000$ Price range stage pianos .. i am planning to buy a nord grand but i wait a bit because i believe they will release a new nord grand 2 or a new stage 4..

title: Can anyone identify this percussion instrument?
post_content: I know these exist. I have seen them. It is sometimes found mounted on some drum kit rigs, as extra percussion, similar role to a cow bell, but can also be found isolated.They are in pairs, pitched. They are made of hard wood and are shaped like conches, or more accurately, the tops of a beansprout head, only they are much larger, each "conch" is about the size of a large fist or small coconut. They are hollow within. Maybe some kind of exotic giant seed?Two "conch-like" wooden, hollow percussion instruments, hit with a stick, pitched.Anyone know their name?Z

title: RE: Can anyone identify this percussion instrument?
post_content: maybe these:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Temple_blocksor these:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wooden_fish

title: RE: Can anyone identify this percussion instrument?
post_content: Temple blocks! You got it in one. So hard to google find without the name!thank youZ

title: New Forum Software Upgrade
post_content: Dear all:it has been way to long, but finaally we will move to a new forum software and backend, based on the latest phpBB software written from scratch.ThereforeFRIDAY 26th 2024, the forum will be offline starting 8am CET, and we hope to be back up the evening.Once up, please feel free to post here issues or bugs you encounter.(We are aware the gallery, download sections, and portal parts are not yet functioning correctly. All data has been saved and backed up, will just require some time to fix the issues (hopefully).).But if you have issues with the normal forum running, please reply here!While some new features will be added (e.g., a dark mode, a new mobile friendly design etc.), a few features will be lost in the upgrade, notably:- The Buy&Sell section ==> in case you want to keep those, please post them exceptionally in a topic here.- Tapatalk support ==> as it has become increasingly annoying IMHO; and the new version supports a nice mobile mode, we will not reinstall support for that.CheersJohannes

title: RE: New Forum Software Upgrade
post_content: Hello JohannesAllow three observations from the operation of the new version of NUF1) Display of post editing statistics data has unclear rules... if post editing starts on the day the post is published, the statistics line is not displayed,examples:viewtopic.php?p=175218#p175218(here in this thread I also had my two posts on the subject of maxpiano's edit, and on testing the display of edit statistics,but they were deleted, one was edited six times from minutes after release to several days ... without displaying a line with statistics)andviewtopic.php?p=175761#p175761(default post was no image)... if the first edit of the post is made in the days following the publication of the post, a row with statistics of edits is displayed,examples:viewtopic.php?p=174897#p174897andviewtopic.php?p=175735#p1757352) Is it possible to return the display of the flag from the user profile to the post in the author field ?3) I like the light/dark color of the NUF page (I already wrote).I have a problem (perhaps only my personal one) with the readability of the text in the frames (see pictures for zoom). If I am not unique in my opinion, I offer variants of solutions: lighter gray for dark mode or the same text color for light/dark mode (as in the header) or increase the spaces between characters.NUF_ligth.jpg (69.51 KiB) Viewed 4370 timesNUF_dark.jpg (56.42 KiB) Viewed 4370 timesthanksbest regardsVojtech

One day will see if I can get a workaround done.Thanks!Best johannes

title: RE: New Forum Software Upgrade
post_content: Thanks for the flagsI look at the posts as an anonymous, not logged in user, in the event that a post has been edited, I see a line with the time of the last modification and the total number of modifications.-- If the post is edited the day after the post is published, the info line will appear ... that's fine.-- If the first edit of the post is made on the day the post is published, the info line is not displayed (even if other changes are made to the post, even in the following days) ... is this not a mistake?I perceive the influence of the color of the title in dark mode - worse readability - especially with some groups of letters (e.g. "NEWESTMEMBERS"). The texts are fixed, immutable, light mode will help when reading, no other comments have been received on this topic, forget my suggestion.rgdsVojtech

title: RE: Search function / Nord Forum

title: RE: Search function / Nord Forum
post_content: Hi,got it, right the SQL search engine does not seem to support exact phrase search using quotes.Testes some others but seems not easily doable without a different search backend.I would suggest to use google search for that. Just enter onwww.google.comCode:Select all"black upright" site:norduserforum.comBest Johannes

title: Steve Winwood in concert
post_content: I recently had the opportunity to see Steve Winwood opening for The Doobie Brothers. It was really nice finally getting to see him after all these years. As much we all strive to get that "perfect" B3 sound for Gimme Some Lovin, it was kinda funny when he started the song with the cleanest B3 I think possible...no hint of overdrive -perhaps a backline fail.

title: RE: Steve Winwood in concert
post_content: I just saw him in Cincinnati and noticed the same thing!

title: Whole band suddenly stopped playing?
post_content: Hi. So I just had an interesting occurence.We (the band) were playing a song live. Rehearsals went well. In one song towards the end there's a section where the band stops playing for a few bars before resuming play until the end of the song. We all have our written parts as well in front of us so not playing by heart.Suddenly during live when that section came on, the whole band didn't even go back in. It's normal if one or two mess up so can still catch up. Bear in mind this was about a 12 piece band with strings, percussion, rhythm but NO ONE resumed playing. I swear to god if I recall back it feels like brain just went dead (or blank) and others felt the same way as well. Whole band is completely dumbfounded.Anyone ever had this kind of experience before?

title: RE: Whole band suddenly stopped playing?
post_content: Well - Life offers some magic moments, nobody will ever find out, where they come from.To compare:Just imagine those moments, when the Guitar Player had the (subjective) feeling,that he needs to extend his Solo, even if tha arrangement says "it enough now".Why not facing a moment onstage,when everybody feels that it would be cool for this day / time / moment,to have the song ending here and now.If everybody give this moment a chance then and waits till very the latest second to join in again, but doesn´t,it could happen that the music (and the song) stops / ends - - and in this case with a perfect ending,that would be a hard job to arrange in written music or re-built in the next rehearsal...So the only thing to say here is: Sometimes you should give Life a chance, to do its thing...

title: OT: A Guide To Starting Your Own Local Band
post_content: Hello, Nord community!About three years ago, I decided to quit my current band and start my own one.  It was a very steep and deep learning experience.  Now that I've done that, and it's all working quite well, I wanted to write up a guide sharing everything that I had learned in the process, aimed at someone who was either running their own band, or considering starting one.At the time, I couldn't find anything like this in my searches, and definitely could have used it at the time.Although it recounts my specific experiences and decisions, it also presents a framework for others to make their decisions in different circumstances.I would appreciate anyone who would care to read it, and maybe offer up a few thoughts on its strong or weak points?  It's a PDF with links to individual Google Docs.Many thanks in advance!

title: RE: OT: A Guide To Starting Your Own Local Band
post_content: Mr Hollis,I am only 3 chapters in, but you appear to have done your normal high level work. You write well! Looks a lot like the start of a book to me.

title: RE: OT: A Guide To Starting Your Own Local Band
post_content: Nicely written indeed! Clear and comprehensive, with great examples and dry humour.

title: RE: OT: A Guide To Starting Your Own Local Band
post_content: This really spoke to me -“It is also useful to share what I wasn’t looking for with my band:I wasn’t looking to pay the bills.  Lots of people are, and that’s understandable.I wasn’t seeking recognition or adulation.  I don’t need to be the center of attention, and I was looking for similar people.I wasn’t looking for a way to relive my errant youth.  Yes, we all had a blast when we were younger, but that was then and this is now.I wasn’t looking for a friendly place to intoxicate myself.  I don’t like playing with intoxicated musicians.I wasn’t looking for a social club for bored retirees.  Where I live, there are a lot of people looking to get out of the house.I wasn’t interested in group therapy sessions.  We all have issues we want to work on, but not here.  Same for politics, religion, etc.I wasn’t looking to recreate School of Rock for beginning musicians.  We all want to get better at our craft, but I’ve been playing continuously since a young age, played in a bunch of different bands, informally studied music theory and history, etc.  I don’t suck.  If you’re a 4.5 at tennis, you want to play with similar players most of the time.  Actually, it would be great to have a tennis-style rating system for musicians!”I’m in the place where I’m thinking of joining or starting a band again (it’s like a 7 year itch for me and it’s been 10 years). I’ve tried to arrange reunions with a band I first played with over 30 years ago but it’s hard when I moved away and some of the guys aren’t really into it anymore.

title: RE: OT: A Guide To Starting Your Own Local Band
post_content: This is very nice, Chuck.  I've always enjoyed reading your well-written blog and your in-depth topical posts, and this guide appears to be a natural extension.  I think the insights can be helpful at most any stage of a band, especially existing bands that want to take the next growth step or aren't progressing at the rate they are expecting.

title: RE: OT: A Guide To Starting Your Own Local Band
post_content: Thank you to all who took the time to read and comment.  Given the positive feedback, I think I'll distribute this a little more widely.I intend to keep updating and will be posting update on patreon.com/thelocalbandmechanicThanks everyone!

title: RE: OT: A Guide To Starting Your Own Local Band
post_content: Well, I'm back!!!  Based on the great feedback here and elsewhere, I did a significant rewrite: new sections, rewrites in many places, and so on.As before, I would welcome anyone who would have the time and interest to read it and provide their thoughts on its strengths and weaknesses.Thanks again!

title: RE: OT: A Guide To Starting Your Own Local Band
post_content: Scanning the various forums, I realized I could write a chapter on "Basic Acoustics For Band Leaders", sort of a survival kit.Here is the link:https://docs.google.com/document/d/1EQv ... sp=sharingAs before, any commentary on strengths and weaknesses would be appreciated!

title: RE: OT: A Guide To Starting Your Own Local Band
post_content: I still haven't reached the last chapter yet, but until now, it was fun to read. And quite inspiring - as external circumstances may vary a lot, it's a matter of getting to think for yourself.(all chapters:https://docs.google.com/document/d/1G2z ... BG_3A/edit)BTW, I like the decision for your band name. Sounds like a great finding: Matches well with music and audience, and probably with the band's motivation, too.

title: Deutsches Nord Forum in Gründung in Facebook
post_content: Hi, darf ich hier für meine neugegründete Nord Gruppe in FB etwas Werbung machen? Falls ja, herzlichen Dank, falls nein, bitte löschenThis thread is only for GERMAN speaking Nord Users, thanksFür Nord Keyboards gibt es bisher wohl nur Gruppen in denen Englisch geschrieben wird. Leider sind manche "Problemchen" etwas komplexerer Natur, und Fremdsprachenkenntnisse reichen oft nicht aus. Deshalb habe ich eine Gruppe für alle Deutsch-Sprachler gegründet in der Hoffung auf regen Zulauf und Austausch. Wer Interesse hat und auf Deutsch kommunizieren kann, ist sehr herzlich eingeladen. Wir dürften zwar überwiegend auch die Umgangssprache Englisch beherrschen, allerdings möchte ich aus den oben genannten Gründen ausschliesslich in der Deutschen Sprache schreiben. Bitte lasst Euch nicht durch die Fragen beim Beitritt anschrecken, diese dienen dazu Spam usw. fernzuhalten. Die Gruppe ist zur Zeit auch noch nicht so gross, gut Ding braucht eben Weile. Die Gruppe heisst "Nord Keyboards Deutschland und Mitteleuropa" , ist privat, aber zu finden, auch unter diesem Linkhttps://www.facebook.com/groups/1147104156695183Sorry wenn manches noch etwas "seltsam" anmutet, es ist meine erste Gruppe die ich gegründet habe, ich muss hier auch noch lernen und mich einfindenViele GrüsseMicha

title: RE: Deutsches Nord Forum in Gründung in Facebook
post_content: Warum Facebook und nicht eine registrierungsfreie normale Webseite? Ich bin sicher, das hält nicht nur mich von einer Teilnahme ab.Nix für ungut...Why Facebook and not an ordinary website free of registration? I am sure not to be the only person who wouldn't join.No offence...

title: RE: Deutsches Nord Forum in Gründung in Facebook
post_content: That’s what came into my mind as well when I saw the post of cbxmicha. As much as I would be in favour of a German-language forum, I'm not keen on joining it if it runs on the Facebook platform. The way Facebook treats and uses any kind of data from his users made me leave this platform many years ago and I will never ever register there again.In addition there is much less reach and presumably knowledge available in a just German speaking community - look at how much input is coming here from all parts of the world, that’s second to none.Just my 2 cents …

title: RE: Deutsches Nord Forum in Gründung in Facebook
post_content: I understand that language (may be an) issue. But if that's the matter:a) It took me a few weeks to feel at ease to write in English which isn't a language I usually use - but you can get accustomed as nobody will laugh at you because of that;b) You can use a translation service like deepl.com or translate.google.com to get your questions into English; and you can use the offer from the web site to read everything automatically translated into your mother tongue - everyone will take into account that some translations are a little 'erroneous' (my favourite translator even handles names like Nord Stage now correctly);c) You'll get answers as long as people will understand and see that you are trying your best;d) I'm sure you may use an AI service to even get translated abstracts and answers on your question. Maybe we should even try to ask ChatGPT to search the forum for an answer on this and that.No need to split up the community for that, I think. And no need to move parts of it behind fences. But of course, it's up to everyone on their own to join(t) whatever they want to.Edit: Typos corrected.

title: RE: Deutsches Nord Forum in Gründung in Facebook
post_content: FZiegler wrote:No need to split up the community for that, I think.I'd say the international nature of this forum is a huge advantage. We get experience, expertise and ideas coming from all over the world. And today's online translators are more than adequate for bridging the language barrier between any two common languages here.And this platform is infinitely better than something like Facebook. Hats off to the mods.Besides: I've learned a huge chunk of my English reading and writing by lurking around NUF threads.

title: RE: Deutsches Nord Forum in Gründung in Facebook
post_content: Sorry, mangels "Erfahrung" in diesen Dingen hatte ich vergessen zu schreiben dass sich dieser Post an deutschsprachige Facebook Mitglieder richtet.Für die Erstellung eines ganzen Forums fehlt mir das Wissen, die Zeit, und es gibt noch einen Haufen mehr Gründe warum das für mich nicht funktioniert.Selbstverständlich würden auch mir 100 Argumente einfallen, man gewöhnt sich an Englisch, ich weiss auch dass ein unabhängiges Forum wesentlich effektiver ist als eine scharf überwachte social media Plattform mit idiotischer Ki Überwachung und vielen mutmaßlichen Deppen als Mitglieder, ich will da aber nicht weiter drauf eingehen, weil das hier den Rahmen sprengt.Als Facebook Mitglied ist es vergleichsweise einfach, einen mutmaßlichen Bedarf zu decken und hier eine Gruppe aufzumachen. Der Bedarf ist da auf dieser Plattform.Ich habe Verständnis für Facebook Verweigerer, habe ich doch selbst über 2 Jahre pausiert weil ich das Ganze Gehabe dort einfach nur noch zum k--- fand.Ich bewege mich dort auch nur mit grosser Vorsicht.Also, wer Facebook Mitglied ist bzw. bereit wäre es zu werden um in die Gruppe zu kommen ist und auf Deutsch kommunizieren kann hiermit herzlich eingeladen.Mehr braucht es in diesem Post nicht an Diskussion. Wer Fragen hat, dem stehe ich gerne zur Verfügung.Edit: Ich stelle eben fest, dass meine Antwort hier sobald ich sie abgeschickt habe im Post einen ganz anderen Wortlaut wiedergibt als ich diese schrieb. Als wenn diese durch einen schlechten Übersetzer geschubst wurde.Ich betone, dass ich einer einwandfreien Orthographie mächtig bin, und hoffe dass das so wie ich es sehe trotzdem verstanden wird.

title: RE: Are videos in postings are deleted after some time?
post_content: analogika wrote:mp3 don't work, and they are definitely natively playable file types — as are the .mp4 in question (they work when downloaded).I wonder if the browser just needs the extension appended to the URL or some such."Natively playable" if you have a player that manages the format (embedded in the browser in this case), on my Mac Mini with Catalina (from where I am typing) that video works fine on Chrome but not on Safari, which (at least in my version) seems not to have a player for it (same for the .mp3, like the demos in Nord Sound Library, for example)

title: RE: Are videos in postings are deleted after some time?
post_content: maxpiano wrote:analogika wrote:mp3 don't work, and they are definitely natively playable file types — as are the .mp4 in question (they work when downloaded).I wonder if the browser just needs the extension appended to the URL or some such."Natively playable" if you have a player that manages the format (embedded in the browser in this case), on my Mac Mini with Catalina (from where I am typing) that video works fine on Chrome but not on Safari, which (at least in my version) seems not to have a player for it (same for the .mp3, like the demos in Nord Sound Library, for example)I believe embedded audio and video files play fine on other forums, though.I meant "natively playable" by the system. You don't need any "player" to manage them, because the operating system itself can do that. (Since they work when downloaded, natively, in the iOS Files.app.) The browser in that case literally has to do nothing but pass the data on to the system, AFAIK. .MP3 and .MP4 are both natively supported file formats, and the standard codecs are also natively supported by the system.I am not a developer, but it seems to me that this is not a case of the player not supporting the format, but the forum software activelybreakingnative support for the formats.

I guess it depends on how videos are embedded, the example linked by Wolfgang has this HTML code<video src="https://www.norduserforum.com/download/ ... 7a4b8c76a2" style="width:100%;max-width:720px;max-height:720px;" controls="">Your browser does not support the video tag.</video>which is how NUF does, maybe other forums don't use the <video> HTML tag but a direct pointer to the file (or other methods to embed)?

title: Deleting a post
post_content: How do I delete a post I put in error, or don't want to have on the forum any longer?

title: RE: Deleting a post
post_content: Hi, there are two ways:a) you edit your post and just put in the content 'deleted' or the like. So everybody knows there's no content any more;b) you hit the '!' triangle to report the post to the mods who in turn may delete your post completely.But posts you wrote may have had an answer, a result or something like that which other people may be interested in as well. So that's the deal: You don't only get answers on your questions for yourself, but also for the use of others. So a question being obsolete for you at a certain moment may be of some importance for others. So that's why posts aren't meant to be just deleted when their raison d'être is past for the thread opener. Erroneous posts is something different.

title: RE: Deleting a post
post_content: Thanks. That explains a lot.

title: RE: Comments & Feedback & Forum Wish List
post_content: It's me again, Martin (White Beach), I just put my question here, maybe someone can help me already.Like I said I have a Stage 2 EX, it's about splitting the keyboard. My problem is: How do I work with it when I want 2 Synth sounds, so Synth on Lwr and another Synth on Mid or Higher keyboard?  Thank you much.

title: RE: Comments & Feedback & Forum Wish List
post_content: Hi,Welcome, please go the to the approrpiate forum, e.g.http://www.norduserforum.com/nord-stage-forum-f3/and click on New Topic to start a new thread.Before doing that, however search this site thoroughly, because most often questions have been asked before and answers are already available.Asking repeated questions often do not trigger new replies.Posting questions in another unrelated thread (like in this one) is not encouraged either and most likely they won't be answered and could be deleted by the moderators. Your question above, is explained in the manual dealing with spits and using 2 different slots. You use both slots A and B (press one, leave it pressed and press the other one), then chosing one or another slot, chose the keyboard split points and zones as desired.As mentioned, this is Chapter 3, The Slots, then  Create a Split, in the NS2 manual, not sure about the NS2EX.Please be aware that this message and the two previous ones will be set to delete after you read them because they do not belong here.

title: OT: Should you play at your own wedding reception?
post_content: I play in a 9-piece soul function band, which does regular wedding and party gigs. For example, we've got two weddings this weekend, and numerous others scattered throughout the summer. I've also got engaged recently and we're planning our wedding for next summer. I think it's pretty much non-negotiable (both from myself and my fiancee) that we want the band to play there.I was trying to find if anyone had blogged or written about playing in your own wedding band at your own wedding, but there doesn't seem to be anything. While I'd personally love to just play music on my Nord Stage all night, a wedding is about US and not ME so that can't be a given. I've got a get-out, which is that the guitarist can also play keyboards (he's a Nord fan and loves my Stage!), and another good friend of mine plays guitar in another function band - and they've played in this configuration occasionally when I've been on holiday and can't do a gig. This means we've got the option of me playing as much or as little as circumstances allow.Has anybody else done this? Did it work out well or did your new partner and half the guests get fed up of you insisting on doing that 20-minute keyboard solo on an obscure prog track?

title: RE: OT: Should you play at your own wedding reception?
post_content: You are going to be busy with lots of other duties and it would generally be a pretty big breach of etiquette to duck out and just be band mate. If you want to play on one or two songs that would be fine, but I would not do more than that.

title: RE: OT: Should you play at your own wedding reception?
post_content: Strictly from a self-preservation standpoint, playing full time at your own reception is a very, very bad ideaAt my wedding (in 1986), I sat in on two tunes and that was it. One was a serenade to my new bride, so it was about US and not ME. It bought me some equity to play a second song. Then off the stage.My regular big band played my son's wedding in 2016. They got a sub for me, and I played only two songs. I first did a little speech for my son and his wife and to talk about the quality and pedigree of the band members (all of whom are better musicians than your truly). The first song was in honor of the Bride and Groom. It bought me some equity to play a second song. Then off the stage.The choice is ultimately yours. My own perspective is that my wife will be here long after my band mates have faded into the dust. She gets priority. The music will be there.Just my tuppence worth.

title: RE: OT: Should you play at your own wedding reception?
post_content: Rusty Mike wrote:The choice is ultimately yours. My own perspective is that my wife will be here long after my band mates have faded into the dust. She gets priority. The music will be there.I hear what you're saying. However, in my case the band members are also friends of us both - we went on holiday together with three of them last year, and I've known two of them for almost 20 years. Still, having the ability to have the band there without requiring me to actually be part of it seems to be the best compromise. I suspect after everyone's had a few drinks I might be asked to get up on stage and play a few numbers, but we can just play it by ear on the day.One of the gigs this weekend is featuring the bride singing and the groom playing guitar for one song while we back them up.

title: RE: OT: Should you play at your own wedding reception?
post_content: We prepared a little music to be played by everyone wanting to assist and bringing their instrument during the afternoon of our wedding (was announced). That was OK for 10 or 15 minutes but already excluded part of the guests as it was mostly fun to the musicians.Besides, I second those who say you shouldn't do more than one or two short songs. Doesn't have much to do with the band being friends with one or both of you. That's what I think about it.

title: RE: OT: Should you play at your own wedding reception?
post_content: You need to be clear whether it's absolutely essential that you have to play. Personally, for me it would be more advisable if you sit it out, unless the flow of your event allows you to play a song or two. I personally didn't join my band when they played for my wedding and it went out fine, I had a sub for me, so it didn't matter if I joined or not.For me if you can get a reliable sub then your band can just work out the setlist where the sub and the band is comfortable with. If you do insist to play, then make sure it's not overkill like you wanting to play full time for your event. I agree with the rest, at least one should be ok but no more than two songs at your disposal.

title: RE: OT: Should you play at your own wedding reception?
post_content: We booked our favourite local funk band — most of them our friends, and some of them colleagues in other projects I play in.I’ve subbed with them a couple of times, so we made the deal that I would play on two or three of my favourite songs later in the evening if I felt like it. I did. It was a splendid time.

title: RE: OT: Should you play at your own wedding reception?
post_content: Keen to hear how this turned outMy daughter is about to get married and I tried to convince her to let my band play. A firm no was received.

title: RE: OT: Should you play at your own wedding reception?
post_content: Ritchie333 wrote:While I'd personally love to just play music on my Nord Stage all night, a wedding is about US and not METhe wedding (meaning the act itself, papers, signatures, rings, "I DO" etc) is about you two.The reception and party is about everybody else. You are, in all honesty, the least important part. At least, that's how weddings usually turn out here in Italy.You have to talk to everybody, greet, make some small speeches, receive gifts, take photos with everybody, walk around the tables, make sure everybody is enjoying, dancing, etc etc. As others have said, maybe you could find the time for one (at the very maximum two) very special song dedicated to your wife, but surely not for shouting and dancing onstage for hours like it was a regular gig.That would be extremely embarassing for everyone involved.Ritchie333 wrote:However, in my case the band members are also friends of us both - we went on holiday together with three of them last year, and I've known two of them for almost 20 years.To me, this makes the situation even worse. Not only you would avoid your social duties on the reception, but you'd make some of your closest friends WORK on your wedding day?Honestly, in this situation I would just book another band with no personal ties, so everyone is free to enjoy himself.Incidentally, this was what I did at my wedding: not even for a second I thought of inviting my band or playing myself. I had planned to sing a couple songs for my wife, but by the time we were free from all the social chores, the dance was on and everybody was having too much fun to kill the vibe with a slow romantic song.

title: RE: OT: Should you play at your own wedding reception?
post_content: A bit off topic here, but I had the same questioning on my 40th birthday.But from the start, I managed to get my band playing with a keyboard backup player, so I could really enjoy the party !This is also fun to hear "almost" the same tunes played with a different keyboardist !Fred

title: Eurovision?
post_content: It's not so big in the US, but is HUGE in Europe.  I saw the Swedish entry Loreen.  I didn't think it was so great a song.  Don't get me wrong, there are some great musicians in Sweden, as in the rest of Europe.  It seems campy to me, but maybe I just don't get it.  What is your opinion?  Do European musicians take this seriously?

title: RE: Eurovision?
post_content: No ….it was serious some decades ago when it was called Grand Prix Eurovision de la Chanson, and at that time the song itself was all that counted and the price went to the song and text writers. Now it’s just ridiculous, musical quality does not count anymore but the most crazy outfit or show

title: RE: Eurovision?
post_content: This is an interesting question. It must have been in my childhood that I last saw part of a show.In my country, the public discussion usually is if at least the public or even the audience takes the contest seriously. I don't know that type of musicians that would care. As there are about 180 mio spectators every year - from Europe, western Asia and northern Africa - it has to be taken seriously from the business side. A certain type of professional composers and producers seem to take it seriously as well.Maybe you need to know that the juries' vote is only 50% - the rest is televoting by the audience. Social media may play a big role. Besides, it's all about national public broadcasting corporations launching their candidates (via jury or televoting or any other way) and juries at the same time, letting them pass through semifinals with nationally separated televotings and collecting votes from other nations in the finals - neither national jury nor audience is allowed to vote for the own country. Acts need to be new, original and semi-playback, aren't allowed to contain a political message in a controversial sense, but don't need to be in the country's language any more (from 1999). As public voting plays a big role and you need to collect points from a lot of countries, a winner act has probably passed a severe test in mass taste and intercultural suitability. I have my imagination what sort of quality statement this is.After 1991, a lot of countries from eastern Europe (including Russia) joined the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as the organiser of the contest. A few years later, a new rule offered the candidates of the Big Five (Germany, France, Britain, Spain and Italy) a wildcard. Sounds like a business driven decision, too.After some years with full public voting, juries are back in the process since 2008. Their members are meant to have 'some relation' to music or the music business. But there have nevertheless been issues with corruption in the past - the last one I know of through the jury of Georgia.

title: RE: Eurovision?
post_content: The Big Five thing is indeed a business decision.The problem was that if any of them didn’t make it into the final, viewership would tank, since they represent the biggest market. This created problems for the whole show that have been avoided since by automatically qualifying them.

title: RE: Eurovision?
post_content: I guess the biggest problem with the Eurovision is that everyone is trying to do two things at once: appeal to the huge international masses and somehow still stand out. The result is a weird yet uninteresting mess.Me being from Finland (we came 2nd, voted 1st by the audience), I heard people talking a lot about how rigged the whole contest is. I'm 97% sure they just want it hosted in Sweden next year because of ABBA's anniversary. So the jury had to vote heavily for Loreen, since the winner is always the next host.

title: RE: Eurovision?
post_content: Yeah, Sweden on ABBA's 50th anniversary is just too good a fit.Either way, it's entertainment industry: I make ZERO assumptions of fairness or neutrality, if there's a good spectacle to be had.You can bet that even *I* will be watching next year if I have time, if only to catch an appearance by ABBA (or their holograms).I love ABBA.

title: RE: Eurovision?
post_content: Well sure. So what that an internationally produced annual tv show is somehow not sincere, if it means that we get more ABBA.

title: RE: Eurovision?
post_content: Exactly. I mean, the "competition" aspect is largely unrelated to the actual music, anyway...

title: Question about sharing sampled keyboards
post_content: The forum rules,forum_rules.php, section 6(III) saysHardware Keyboards, Synths or ROMplers and natural instruments are typically allowed to be resampled and freely distributedI'm pretty sure that this is incorrect.  Any recording (e.g., sample) is implicitly copyrighted in the US and most other countries.  Any re-recording of those recordings (e.g., by sampling a digital piano) is subject to the original copyright.  I seriously doubt that it's "typically allowed" to sample a digital piano and distribute the samples.Instruments that are not based on samples are not covered by copyright protection.  So, most analog hardware keyboards and synths (even digital synths when not using samples), are fine to sample and distribute, as are natural instruments or electromechanical instruments.Can anyone back up the Rules statement?  Is it guesswork or is it based on solid legal advice?IANAL, but my father was an intellectual properties attorney and we'd discussed these issues, and I've studied material at copyright.us.gov .  This is also often discussed among sound designers and the general agreement is that it's risky to distribute samples of instruments that are covered by copyrights.It sure would be nice if I could freely distribute my samples of the Yamaha S90ES piano, Ensoniq MR76 piano, and a number of Yamaha CP4 pianos and epianos.  But I think I would be violating Yamaha's copyrights.  (I have these samples so that I can use them in my DAW, which is way more convenient than having to always use the hardware keyboard.)

title: RE: Question about sharing sampled keyboards
post_content: There is a difference between samples and resamples though?

title: RE: Question about sharing sampled keyboards
post_content: JeffLearman wrote:The forum rules,forum_rules.php, section 6(III) saysHardware Keyboards, Synths or ROMplers and natural instruments are typically allowed to be resampled and freely distributedI'm pretty sure that this is incorrect.  Any recording (e.g., sample) is implicitly copyrighted in the US and most other countries.  Any re-recording of those recordings (e.g., by sampling a digital piano) is subject to the original copyright.  I seriously doubt that it's "typically allowed" to sample a digital piano and distribute the samples.Instruments that are not based on samples are not covered by copyright protection.  So, most analog hardware keyboards and synths (even digital synths when not using samples), are fine to sample and distribute, as are natural instruments or electromechanical instruments.Can anyone back up the Rules statement?  Is it guesswork or is it based on solid legal advice?IANAL, but my father was an intellectual properties attorney and we'd discussed these issues, and I've studied material at copyright.us.gov .  This is also often discussed among sound designers and the general agreement is that it's risky to distribute samples of instruments that are covered by copyrights.It sure would be nice if I could freely distribute my samples of the Yamaha S90ES piano, Ensoniq MR76 piano, and a number of Yamaha CP4 pianos and epianos.  But I think I would be violating Yamaha's copyrights.  (I have these samples so that I can use them in my DAW, which is way more convenient than having to always use the hardware keyboard.)From Yamaha S90ES manualhttps://usa.yamaha.com/files/download/o ... es_en1.pdfpage 6:This product incorporates and bundles computer programs and contents in whichYamaha owns copyrights or with respect to which it has license to use others’ copyrights. Suchcopyrighted materials include, without limitation, all computer software, style files, MIDI files,WAVE data, musical scores and sound recordings.Any unauthorized use of such programs and contents outside of personal use is not permitted under relevant laws. Any violation of copyright has legal consequences. DON’T MAKE, DISTRIBUTE OR USE ILLEGAL COPIES.So I agree with you, that statement is incorrect or partial i.e. in case of ROMplers it should suggest to check each instrument's manual and copyright statements.

title: RE: Question about sharing sampled keyboards
post_content: maxpiano wrote:From Yamaha S90ES manualhttps://usa.yamaha.com/files/download/o ... es_en1.pdfpage 6:This product incorporates and bundles computer programs and contents in whichYamaha owns copyrights or with respect to which it has license to use others’ copyrights. Suchcopyrighted materials include, without limitation, all computer software, style files, MIDI files,WAVE data, musical scores and sound recordings.Any unauthorized use of such programs and contents outside of personal use is not permitted under relevant laws. Any violation of copyright has legal consequences. DON’T MAKE, DISTRIBUTE OR USE ILLEGAL COPIES.So I agree with you, that statement is incorrect or partial i.e. in case of ROMplers it should suggest to check each instrument's manual and copyright statements.It may be splitting hairs, but I would interpret wave data as the code to create the sound and not the audio of sound itself. Although I’m not sure what is meant by “sound recordings” in that statement.

title: RE: Question about sharing sampled keyboards
post_content: Wave data are the ROM waveforms, I would have no doubt about that, software is mentioned separately. What instead is in fact questionable is that, since the copyright applies only to "Wave Data", that means you cannot copy the raw waveforms data, but you may still be entitled to sample a Patch that uses that wave data as starting point, because the final (sound) product is different ...

title: RE: Question about sharing sampled keyboards
post_content: Sorry, you can't copyright a sound, including the sound of an instrument.  Imagine if royalties had to be paid on guitar sounds, drum sounds, harmonica sounds, etc. for every recording.   Agree with above, the bit patterns that create the sounds are software, and thus can carry a copyright.  Trademarks are a different story.

title: RE: Question about sharing sampled keyboards
post_content: cphollis wrote:Sorry, you can't copyright a sound, including the sound of an instrument.  Imagine if royalties had to be paid on guitar sounds, drum sounds, harmonica sounds, etc. for every recording.   Agree with above, the bit patterns that create the sounds are software, and thus can carry a copyright.  Trademarks are a different story.Right, you can't copyright "a sound", but you can copyright "a recording."  Once a recording is copyrighted, you can't use someone else's copyrighted recordings mixed in with other stuff and forget the original copyright.  (Much to the dismay of people who use samples in music.)  There is a limit: if you change the recording enough so that it dramatically changes the character, you can escape copyright claims.  But I doubt that embedding re-recorded piano note samples to make a copy digital instrument would pass that test.Clearly, music instrument manufacturers claim that you can't do this.  But as I mentioned above, they often make claims that aren't legally supportable (just like, back in the old days, we used to sign leases that had unenforceable clauses.)But in this case, I think that Yamaha is on good legal footing, and that if I sampled a digital piano and distributed the samples, they'd have a valid claim against me.The protection that sampled instruments get from copyright laws like the US's DCMA is an accidental legal benefit.  The laws weren't intended to protect instrument manufacturers.  For example, there's nothing in there to prevent you from sampling your real grand piano (or your Harley Davidson motorcycle) and using that to make a software instrument.  What it does cover is "sound recordings" which is exactly what samples are.  So, DP manufacturers are covered, mostly as an unintended consequence.A fuzzier area is modeled instruments.  My suspicion is that any company's legal team and marketing team would have very different ideas on whether an instrument was sampled or modeled.  I bet if someone created a software piano based on what is marketed as a "modeled piano", the legal team would say, "Yeah, but it's sampled too."  But if it's demonstrable that the instrument truly is modeled and not based on samples with modeled "extras", then copyrights would not provide any protection.

title: RE: Question about sharing sampled keyboards
post_content: Copyright law has some funny wrinkles.  For example, let's say you write a song and either jot down notation for it, or make a quick recording on your phone.  Your song is now copyrighted, automatically.  If someone copies it, you can sue.Now say you make up a song and play it in public but don't ever write it down or record it, and someone else comes along and copies your song.  What's your legal status?  Zippo.  You have no copyright.  To get a copyright, a work of an author or artist has to be rendered in a "fixed medium" (and a digital recording on any kind of file system qualifies.)So, the sounds "in the air" aren't copyrighted per se.  But the fixed medium is, and that copyright applies to other people's "in the air" copies.

title: RE: Question about sharing sampled keyboards
post_content: Rusty Mike wrote:It may be splitting hairs, but I would interpret wave data as the code to create the sound and not the audio of sound itself. Although I’m not sure what is meant by “sound recordings” in that statement."Wave data" is "sound recorded in a fixed medium" and is covered by copyright.  "Sound recordings" is a bit odd, since it seems synonymous with "wave data" -- unless they're trying to protect modeled sounds as "wave data" and if so, they're on pretty shaky ground.  I suspect they're just covering their bases over the interpretation of "wave data."The only protections they have are copyrights, trademarks, and patents.  Patents don't apply here.  And while Harley Davidson does have trademark coverage for the sound of a Harley (which personally I find dubious but my opinion doesn't matter), instrument makers can't claim the sounds of their instruments as trademarks.

title: Lean back and enjoy - biggest threads
post_content: More than 500 contributions to a single thread within 5 days? Has this happened before on that forum? No idea about historic events as I'm only a member for about 3 years. But let's lean back and have a look while the fastest growing thread within the last 10 years (and probably ever) doesn't pause.The forum is famous for a few things (apart from friendly users) that developed within its sphere: the MIDI tutorial, the users' sounds library, the Stage 2/3 program viewer, the amplification FAQ, wish lists for new gear. I opted for the MIDI tutorial thread as a reference for calibrating my research for long NUF threads. Enjoy!GENERALHERE IT COMES STAGE 4 ?(2022..2023 with 161 replies)Nord Christmas Gift ?(2020..2023 with 206 replies)White Grand(2019..2021 with 159 replies)Next version of MacOS probably doesn't support Sound Manager(2019..2020 with 193 replies)Rhodes - why only new piano samples and no proper Rhodes(2016 with 149 replies)NORD STAGENORD STAGE 4 officially announced for February 16th 2023(2023 with 534 replies)NS2 and NS3 program viewer(2020..2023 with 181 replies)Nord Stage 3 - hammond B3 sound(2017..2022 with 521 replies)List of Nord Stage 3 known issues/bugs(2017..2022 with 281 replies)NS3 Velocity and General Sound vs NS2(2017..2021 with 264 replies)NS3 dual KB is totally crippled by OSv1.24(2017..2018 with 140 replies)NS3 Bug reports etc.(2017..2018 with 259 replies)Nord Stage 3(2017 with 700 replies)Stage Classic vs NS2 ?? (Help please)(2012..2015 with 177 replies)Petition for a new RHODES sample (sign if you want it)(2012..2014 with 144 replies)Nord Stage and MIDI tutorial(2011..2022 with 136 replies)NS2 Wish List: Something missing on the NS2?(2011-2017 with 306 replies)List of Nord Stage 2 known issues/bugs(2011..2017 with 175 replies)NORD ELECTRONord Electro 7, what features do people want?(2018..2022 with 138 replies)New Nord Electro 6(2018..2020 with 141 replies)NORD PIANO/GRANDNord Piano 5 [RELEASED](2021..2023 with 253 replies)Nord grand(2019 with 152 replies)Nord Piano 3 Key knocking noise(2016..2022 with 161 replies)NORD WAVE/WAVE2Anyone also disappointed by the W2?(2020..2022 with 132 replies)Nord Wave 2 introduced(2020..2022 with 258 replies)PROGRAMS & SAMPLESNS3 program viewer(2020..2023 with 181 replies)Nord User Sample Library Development Thread(2019..2021 with 281 replies)ACCESSORIES ETCGear Alert: new QSC K8.2(2017..2020 with 174 replies)Apparently, most monster threads refer to freshly announced (a.k.a. released) instruments. Which may result from emotions and mistiness. I didn't check the other reasons involved - OT discussions, vast fields with an abundance of questions etc. In any case: Thanks to Johannes and the mods to operate this forum! This is a nice place to be.

title: This forum has been hacked
post_content: I just got information that my account on this forum have been picked up on a list of hacked account. Not a big deal on this forum, but if anybody use the same password on this forum as on other accounts - now is the time to change your passwords.

title: RE: This forum has been hacked
post_content: Thank you for letting that notification!Do you have any hints if this is a problem that should come from stolen data from the website (which might affect all of us) or from your computer (which might be a problem for any other account you are using, but not others)? EDIT: Or to ask in another way: Is that list you were talking about an evidence that the forum system itself was hacked?

title: RE: This forum has been hacked
post_content: My login data from this site have *not* been leaked.Are you certain that this is the only place you use those particular login credentials?Also, note that iOS will warn you if a particular password has been scraped and shows up in a dump, even if the login name or e-mail address has not been associated with it. So, if anybody else has used the same password as you do here, on any site whose login data has been hacked anywhere on the internet, you will get a warning about this site.This is because the first thing that hackers do when trying to compromise accounts is to check a list of things people have previously used as passwords.

post_content: That message only means that the password you use on this forum has also been found in some list of "stolen" passwords, not that it was stolen from this site, neither that it was yours (maybe someone else using the same pwd).Maybe the password you use is too generic (or "easy") and/or you are using the same password on other websites and one of those has been hacked, instead.
